pergunta: What is the maximum time that scrum recommends the team spend in the daily scrum?
respostas: Fifteen minutes
Thirty minutes
One hour
Four hours
As long as it takes
correta: Fifteen minutes

pergunta: Which statement is an incorrect assessment of the product owner?
respostas: The product owner plays a dual role: product owner and scrum master
The product owner is the only person responsible for the product backlog
The product owner prioritizes the product backlog
The product owner is one person and not a committee
correta: The product owner plays a dual role: product owner and scrum master

pergunta: Which statement best describes the sprint backlog as an outcome of the sprint planning?
respostas: It is the development teams plan for the sprint
Each task is estimated in hours
It is a complete list of all work to be done in a sprint
It is ordered by the product owner
Every item has a designated owner
correta: It is the development teams plan for the sprint

pergunta: Assuming a 2-week sprint, what is the time-box for the sprint review?
respostas: 2 hours at the end of every sprint
15 minutes
However long is needed
4 hours
correta: 2 hours at the end of every sprint

pergunta: The reason the scrum master is at the daily scrum is:
respostas: He or she does not have to be there; he or she only has to ensure the development team has a daily scrum
To write down any changes to the sprint backlog, including adding new items, and tracking progress on the burndown
To make sure everyone corretas the three perguntas in order of seniority
So he or she knows what to report to management
correta: He or she does not have to be there; he or she only has to ensure the development team has a daily scrum

pergunta: When many development teams are working on a single product, what best describes the definition of done?
respostas: All development teams must have a definition of done that when their work integrates results in a definition of done that is potentially releasable
Each development team defines and uses its own; the various differences are discussed and reconciled during the stabilization phase
Each development team uses its own but must make it clear to all other teams if there are differences
It depends
correta: All development teams must have a definition of done that when their work integrates results in a definition of done that is potentially releasable

pergunta: When does scrum team membership change?
respostas: As needed, while taking into account short term reduction in productivity
Every Sprint, to promote team learning
Never, because it reduces productivity
Whenever management tells the scrum team
correta: As needed, while taking into account short term reduction in productivity

pergunta: The CEO asks the development team to add a very important item to the current sprint. What should the development team do?
respostas: Inform the product owner so he/she can work with the CEO
Add the item to the current sprint and drop an item of equal size
Add the item to the next sprint
correta: Inform the product owner so he/she can work with the CEO

pergunta: The maximum length of the sprint review (its timebox) is:
respostas: 4 hours for a monthly sprint; proportionally less for shorter sprints
1 day
2 hours
As long as needed
correta: 4 hours for a monthly sprint; proportionally less for shorter sprints

pergunta: When a development team determines that it has overcommitted itself for a sprint, who has to be present when reviewing and adjusting the sprint work selected?
respostas: The product owner and the development team
The scrum master, the project manager, and the development team
The development team
The product owner and all stakeholders
correta: The product owner and the development team

pergunta: Backlog Grooming and Backlog Refinement are the same thing.
respostas: True
False
correta: True

pergunta: In which meeting do you capture lessons learned?
respostas: Sprint Planning
Sprint Review
Sprint Retrospective
Daily Status Meeting
correta: Sprint Retrospective

pergunta: Which is NOT a Scrum Role?
respostas: Project Manager
Scrum Master
Product Owner
Team Member
correta: Project Manager

pergunta: Sprints are never longer than a calendar month:
respostas: False
True
correta: True

pergunta: All of the following are attributes of the Definition of Done, EXCEPT:
respostas: It is a static artifact
It is an audible checklist
It is a primary reporting mechanism for team members on user stories progress
It is crucial for a high-performing team
correta: It is a static artifact

pergunta: The Scrum Master is a management role?
respostas: False
True
correta: True

pergunta: Who updates work remaining during the Sprint?
respostas: The Scrum Master
The Development Team
Senior Executives
The Product Owner
correta: The Development Team

pergunta: The Product Backlog is baselined at the start of the project and not changed for at least 3 Sprints
respostas: False
True
correta: False

pergunta: To truly adopt Scrum, you must pick and choose what roles, artifacts, events, and rules are right for your organization.
respostas: False
True
correta: False

pergunta: Sprints lengths can vary each Sprint as long as they don't exceed a month.
respostas: False
True
correta: True

pergunta: The person responsible for the Scrum process, making sure it is used correctly and maximizing its benefit:
respostas: Product Owner
Coach
Scrum Master
Scrum Manager
correta: Scrum Master

pergunta: When does Inspection occur?
respostas: Only at the end of the Sprint
Throughout the Sprint
Whenever the Product Owner wishes
Frequently, but not so often that it gets in the way of work
correta: Frequently, but not so often that it gets in the way of work

pergunta: How long is the Time-Box for the Daily Scrum?
respostas: It depends
5 minutes per person on the Development Team
15 minutes
Whatever the team decides
correta: 15 minutes

pergunta: Scrum is NOT:
respostas: A set of software project management principles
Founded on empirical process control theory
A process framework used to manage the development of products
Designed for static requirements
correta: Designed for static requirements

pergunta: Who tracks the work remaining in the Product Backlog?
respostas: Senior Executives
Product Owner
Scrum Master
Development Team
correta: Product Owner

pergunta: The Backlog is ordered by:
respostas: The needs of the Product Owner
Risks
Complexity
Size
correta: The needs of the Product Owner

pergunta: When is a Sprint finished?
respostas: When the work remaining is zero
When the Product Owner accepts the increment
When the time-box duration is met
When the Definition of Done is met
correta: When the time-box duration is met

pergunta: Who is responsible for ordering the Product Backlog?
respostas: Development Team
Scrum Master
The Project Manager
Product Owner
correta: Product Owner

pergunta: The Scrum Master's job is to work with the Scrum Team and the organization to increase the awareness of the artifacts. Which pillar of Scrum does this represents?
respostas: Transparency
Agility
Adaptation
Inspection
correta: Transparency

pergunta: If the Sprint Backlog cannot be completed in a Sprint, who resolves the issue?
respostas: Scrum Master
Development Team
Product Owner
Both the Product Owner and Development Team
correta: Both the Product Owner and Development Team

pergunta: This role would be responsible for determining when a release can occur:
respostas: Product Owner
Scrum Master
Development Team
Agile Project Boss
correta: Product Owner

pergunta: If a customer really wants a feature added to a Sprint, how should the Development Team respond?
respostas: Ask the Product Owner to work with the customer
Add the item to the Product Backlog for priorization in the next Sprint
Add the feature in the current Sprint Backlog
Escalate to the Scrum Master
correta: Ask the Product Owner to work with the customer

pergunta: Who can change the Sprint Backlog during a Sprint?
respostas: Product Owner
Scrum Master
Development Team
correta: Development Team

pergunta: The purpose of a sprint is to produce a done increment of a product.
respostas: True
False
correta: True

pergunta: What happens if all the necessary testings doesnt occur in a Sprint?
respostas: The User Story is moved to the next Sprint
Additional testers are added in the next Sprint
A risk of not creating a potentially shippable product occur
The burndown chart is updated
correta: A risk of not creating a potentially shippable product occur

pergunta: All of the following are true about change during a Sprint EXCEPT:
respostas: The Product Owner is the only person that can add or remove a User Story in the Product Backlog
The development team can change task in the Sprint Backlog
Changes can be made that impact Sprint Goal
Change may occur as scope is clarified between the Product Owner and the Development Team
correta: Changes can be made that impact Sprint Goal

pergunta: When was Scrum first introduced?
respostas: In 2001 with the Agile Manifesto
In 1995 at a conference presentation
At General Electric as part of a Lean approach
In 2000 along with Extreme Programming
correta: In 1995 at a conference presentation

pergunta: Who creates the Sprint Goal?
respostas: The Development Team
The Scrum Master
The Product Owner
The entire Scrum Team
correta: The entire Scrum Team

pergunta: Which of the following statements best describes product backlog items?
respostas: Undefined or poorly defined product backlog items should be placed on the product backlog with low priority
All product backlog items are the result of a(n) analysis, requirements and/or design phase(s)
Undefined or poorly defined product backlog items should be kept out from the product backlog until sufficient detail is known
Every product backlog item, whether low priority or high priority, should possess sufficient detail for the team to complete in a sprint
correta: Undefined or poorly defined product backlog items should be placed on the product backlog with low priority

pergunta: When does scrum team membership change?
respostas: As needed, while taking into account short term reduction in productivity
Every Sprint, to promote team learning
Never, because it reduces productivity
Whenever management tells the scrum team
correta: As needed, while taking into account short term reduction in productivity

pergunta: Which best describes the product backlog
respostas: It is allowed to grow and change as more is learned about the product and its customers
It is baselined to follow change management processes
It provides just enough information to enable a scrum team to start the design phase of a product
It contains all foreseeable tasks and requirements from which the scrum team can develop and maintain a complete project plan
correta: It is allowed to grow and change as more is learned about the product and its customers

pergunta: What is the release burndown?
respostas: A measure of the remaining product backlog across the time of a release plan
A graph indicating what has been completed by the scrum team
What has been completed by the scrum team to date
The work remaining to be completed by the product owner
correta: A measure of the remaining product backlog across the time of a release plan

pergunta: Which statement best describes a product owner's responsibility?
respostas: Managing the project and ensuring that the work meets the commitments to the stakeholders
Optimizing the return on investment (ROI) and the total cost of ownership (TCO) of the work the development team does
Keeping stakeholders at bay
Directing the development team
correta: Optimizing the return on investment (ROI) and the total cost of ownership (TCO) of the work the development team does

pergunta: What's the scrum team definition of 'done'?
respostas: Whatever the product owner wants it to be
Whatever the stakeholders want it to be
Whatever the scrum master wants it to be
Whatever the scrum team defines 'done' to be
correta: Whatever the scrum team defines 'done' to be

pergunta: Which objectives are covered as part of the sprint planning?
respostas: Understanding what functionality the product owner desires within the next sprint and figuring out how to do it
Updating the scope of the release with all sprints, end dates, and costs
Recalculating empirical velocity, adjusting team capacity accordingly, and projecting end dates
Reviewing current functionality that binds the software solution
correta: Understanding what functionality the product owner desires within the next sprint and figuring out how to do it

pergunta: A new developer has joined an existing scrum team. He/she is having continuing conflicts with existing members and is making the environment hostile. If necessary, who is responsible for removing the new team member, and why?
respostas: The development team is responsible because it is a selfmanaging team, although it may have to be advised by the scrum master
The manager to whom he/she reports is responsible because he/she has authority for hiring and firing
The scrum master is responsible because he/she needs to remove impediments
The product owner is responsible because he/she controls the return on investment of the work
correta: The development team is responsible because it is a selfmanaging team, although it may have to be advised by the scrum master

pergunta: What does it mean for a development team to be cross-functional?
respostas: The development team includes cross-skilled individuals who are able to contribute to do what is necessary to deliver an increment of software
The development team is a virtual team drawing from separate teams of business analysts, architects, developers, and testers
The development team includes not only developers but also business analysts, architects, developers, and testers
Developers on the development team work closely with business analysts, architects, developers, and testers who are not on the team
correta: The development team includes cross-skilled individuals who are able to contribute to do what is necessary to deliver an increment of software

pergunta: Which statement best describes the sprint review?
respostas: It is when the scrum team and stakeholders inspect the outcome of the sprint and figure out what to do in the upcoming sprint
It is a demo at the end of the sprint for everyone in the organization to provide feedback on the work done
It is a review of the team's activities during the sprint
It is used to congratulate the development team if it did what it committed to doing, or to punish the development team if it failed to meet its commitments
correta: It is when the scrum team and stakeholders inspect the outcome of the sprint and figure out what to do in the upcoming sprint

pergunta: The scrum master observes the product owner struggling with ordering the product backlog. What would you consider an appropriate action for the scrum master to take?
respostas: Offer the product owner help in ordering the product backlog from an understanding that the goal is to maximize value
Present the product owner with an ordered product backlog to use
Suggest that the development team does the ordering to be sure that it is a feasible ordering of work
Suggest the product owner extend the sprint, so he can have more time to order the product backlog
Encourage the product owner to work with the development team to see which items technically are fastest to implement
correta: Offer the product owner help in ordering the product backlog from an understanding that the goal is to maximize value

pergunta: Who must do all the work to make sure product backlog items conform to the definition of 'done?'
respostas: The scrum team
The product owner
The development team
The scrum master
correta: The scrum team

pergunta: A scrum team is only allowed to meet with stakeholders during the sprint review.
respostas: True
False
correta: False

pergunta: What part of the sprint backlog is used for the sprint burndown chart?
respostas: The remaining time required to complete each task by each team member
The percentage of work completed by each team member
The number of product backlog items completed by all the team members
The actual time spent on each task by each team member
correta: The remaining time required to complete each task by each team member

pergunta: You are the new scrum master at a company currently doing RUP approach in three month iterations. Your current task in switching from RUP to scrum is to define how long the sprint cycle should be. In what units of time should you define the sprint cycle?
respostas: A fixed amount of days
A fixed amount of months
A fixed amount of weeks, excluding holidays
A fixed amount of hours
correta: A fixed amount of days

pergunta: How should multiple scrum teams deliver a done, potentially shippable increment in a sprint for a Project?
respostas: Each sprint, all scrum teams have a done increment that integrates with all of the other done increments from all other scrum teams on the initiative; the sum of all of increments is the increment for that initiative or project
Each scrum team delivers done increments of its own area of responsibility; these increments are integrated into a whole product during stabilization prior to release
Each scrum team provides a unique done increment that includes the team's added functionality

Functionality not integrated with the work of other scrum teams may be delivered as unintegrated increments; this demonstrates the value created by the scrum teams unable to completely integrate their increments
correta: Each sprint, all scrum teams have a done increment that integrates with all of the other done increments from all other scrum teams on the initiative; the sum of all of increments is the increment for that initiative or project

pergunta:
You are the Scrum Master and your development team of 6 members has completed six sprints with the following information:
Sprint 1: 10 points
Sprint 2: 11 points
Sprint 3: 15 points
Sprint 4: 14 points
Sprint 5: 15 points
Sprint 6: 10 points
The remaining story points for product development totals 42.

What is the approximate number of sprints required to complete the product development?
Which statement below best describes the primary objective of the sprint review?
respostas: The primary objective of the sprint review is to demonstrate the sprint's work and to receive feedback from the product owner(s) on the work completed in the sprint
The primary objective of the sprint review is to demonstrate the sprint's work for senior management
The primary objective of the sprint review is to demonstrate the sprint's work and to receive feedback from the scrum master on the work completed in the sprint
The primary objective of the sprint review is to demonstrate the sprint's work and to recommend ways to work better in the sprint
correta: The primary objective of the sprint review is to demonstrate the sprint's work and to receive feedback from the product owner(s) on the work completed in the sprint

pergunta: What is the primary objective of the Daily Scrum?
respostas: To share with the team what each member has completed in the sprint, what each member will work on next, and to report progress roadblocks
To give a status report to the product owner on what each member has completed in the sprint, what each member will work on next, and to report progress roadblocks
To discuss work details with the team since every team member must attend the meeting
To give a status report to the scrum master on what each member has completed in the sprint, what each member will work on next, and to report progress roadblocks
correta: To share with the team what each member has completed in the sprint, what each member will work on next, and to report progress roadblocks

pergunta: The individual, detailed pieces of work that are needed to convert a product backlog item into a working software component or solution are called
respostas: Tasks
Use Cases
Line Items
Use Stories
correta: Tasks

pergunta: The sprint planning meeting is comprised of how many sections?
What is Release Burndown?
respostas: A measure of the remaining product backlog across the time of a release plan
A graph indicating what has been completed by the scrum team
What has been completed by the scrum team to date
The work remaining to be completed by the product owner
correta: A measure of the remaining product backlog across the time of a release plan

pergunta: Why does scrum prevent product owners from changing product backlog items that are being worked on during the Sprint?
respostas: The development team cannot meet their sprint commitment to complete work if requirements are changing
A sprint cycle is not enough time for senior management to review and approve changes
The development team must be able to limit the product owner authority
This forces product owners to focus on what is really important for the team to develop
correta: The development team cannot meet their sprint commitment to complete work if requirements are changing

pergunta: Which objectives are covered as part of the sprint planning?
respostas: Understanding what functionality the product owner desires within the next sprint and figuring out how to do it
Updating the scope of the release with all sprints, end dates, and costs
Reviewing current functionality that binds the software solution
Recalculating empirical velocity, adjusting team capacity accordingly, and projecting end dates
correta: Understanding what functionality the product owner desires within the next sprint and figuring out how to do it

pergunta: Which of the following statements best explains what the term sprint means in scrum?
respostas: A sprint is a specific amount of days for a team to work at a sustainable pace to finish select work
A sprint is a specific amount of days for a team to test and resolve any issues prior to product release or shipment
A sprint is an agreed upon period of time for team members to select individual items from the product backlog to work on
A sprint is a specific amount of days for a team to work as many hours as needed to finish assigned work
correta: A sprint is a specific amount of days for a team to work at a sustainable pace to finish select work

pergunta: The Scrum Master as a Servant Leader is in service to which of the following?
respostas: The Development Team
The Organization
The Product Owner and the Development Team
The Organization, the Product Owner and the Development Team
correta: The Organization, the Product Owner and the Development Team

pergunta: When do Development Team members take ownership of a Sprint Backlog item?
respostas: During the Daily Scrum
Whenever a team member can accommodate more work
At the Sprint Planning meeting
Never. All Sprint Backlog Items are 'owned' by the entire Development Team, even though each one may be done by an individual Development Team member.
correta: Never. All Sprint Backlog Items are 'owned' by the entire Development Team, even though each one may be done by an individual Development Team member.

pergunta: For the purpose of transparency, when does Scrum say a new increment of working software must be available?
respostas: Before the release Sprint
Every 3 Sprints
At the end of every Sprint
When the Product Owner asks to create one.
correta: At the end of every Sprint

pergunta: Who must attend the Daily Scrum?
respostas: The Development Team and the Scrum Master
The Development Team and the Product Owner
The Scrum Team
The Development Team
correta: The Development Team

pergunta: What activities would a Product Owner typically undertake in the phase between the end of the current Sprint and the start of the next Sprint?
respostas: Update the project plan with stakeholders
Refine the Product Backlog
There are no such activities, the next Sprint starts immediately after the current Sprint
Work with the QA department on the increment of the current Sprint
correta: There are no such activities, the next Sprint starts immediately after the current Sprint

pergunta: Cross-functional teams are optimized to work on one technical layer of a system only (e.g. GUI, database, middle tier, interfaces).
respostas: True
False
correta: False

pergunta: What enhances the transparency of an Increment?
respostas: Doing all work needed to meet the 'Definition of Done'
Keeping track of and estimating all undone work to be completed in a separate Sprint
Updating Sprint tasks properly in the electronic tracking tool
Reporting Sprint progress to the stakeholders daily
correta: Doing all work needed to meet the 'Definition of Done'

pergunta: When is a Product Backlog item considered done?
respostas: When all work in the Sprint Backlog related to the item is finished
When the item has no work remaining in order to be released
When QA reports that the item passes all acceptance criteria
At the end of the Sprint
correta: When the item has no work remaining in order to be released

pergunta: Which of the following is required by Scrum?
respostas: Release Planning
Sprint Retrospective
Sprint Burndown Chart
Members must stand up at the Daily Scrum
All of the above
correta: Sprint Retrospective

pergunta: Multiple Scrum Teams working on the same project must have the same Sprint start date.
respostas: True
False
correta: False

pergunta: What is the time-box for the Sprint Planning meeting?
respostas: Whenever it is done
4 hours for a monthly Sprint
Monthly
8 hours for a monthly Sprint
correta: 8 hours for a monthly Sprint

pergunta: When a Development Team is having trouble delivering a working increment because they don't understand a functional requirement, what should they do?
respostas: Add a specialist to the Development Team
Collaborate with the Product Owner to determine what is possible and acceptable
Partially complete the functionality, and discuss the remaining work at the Sprint Review
Defer the work to a more appropriate Sprint
correta: Collaborate with the Product Owner to determine what is possible and acceptable

pergunta: The Product Owner determines how many Product Backlog items the Development Team selects for a Sprint.
respostas: True, accordingly to what was committed to the stakeholders
True, but only after confirmation by the resource manager that the team has enough capacity
True
False - the Scrum Master does that
False
False, capacity and commitment are the project managerÂ´s responsibility
correta: False

pergunta: Who should make sure everyone on the Development Team does his or her tasks for the Sprint?
respostas: The Development Team
The Product Owner
The project manager
The Scrum Master
All of the above
correta: The Development Team

pergunta: What is the accountability of the Product Owner during Sprint 0?
respostas: There is no such thing as Sprint 0
Determine the composition of the Development Teams so they have the capacity to deliver the completed forecast
Make the complete project plan to commit date, budget and scope to the stakeholders
Gathering, eliciting, and analyzing the requirements that will be inserted into the Product Backlog
Make sure enough Product Backlog items are refined to fill the first 3 Sprints
correta: There is no such thing as Sprint 0

pergunta: A Product Owner wants advice from the Scrum Master about estimating work in Scrum. Which of these is the guideline that a Scrum Master should give?
respostas: Estimates are made by the Development Team
Estimates are made by the Product Owner, but are best checked with the Development Team
Product backlog items must be estimated in story points
Scrum forbids estimating
Estimates must be in relative units
correta: Estimates are made by the Development Team

pergunta: How should the Development Team deal with non-functional requirements?
respostas: Handle them during the integration Sprint preceding the release Sprint
Make sure the release department understands these requirements, but it is not the Development Team responsibility
Leave them for the lead developers on the team
Assure every Increment meets them
correta: Assure every Increment meets them

pergunta: When does the second Sprint start?
respostas: Once the architectural changes for the second Sprint have been approved by the senior architect
After the customer completes acceptance testing of the first Sprint
After the Product Backlog for the second Sprint has been selected
Immediately after the first Sprint
correta: Immediately after the first Sprint
